plugins.name: Draft Alpha
plugins.description:
DraftAlpha – Figma Plugin

Deliver consistent UX content aligned with your brand guidelines


DraftAlpha enables you to effortlessly create, collaborate, and maintain brand-consistent UX content directly within Figma.


Key Features:


✅ AI-powered Brand Guidelines Builder

- Instantly generate tailored brand guidelines, including writing rules, tone of voice, target audience, and brand pillars.

- Customize guidelines precisely to reflect your brand identity.


✅ Content Consistency & Compliance

- Automatically check content for adherence to your established brand guidelines.

- Generate multiple content variants aligned with your brand.


✅ Centralized Content & Collaboration

- Single source of truth for all UX copy and team collaboration.

- Approval workflows, user roles, and content status management.

- Build reusable content components with localization support.


✅ Seamless Localization

- Quickly generate brand-consistent localized content in 20+ languages.

- Manage and apply localization variants directly in Figma.


✅ Integrated Figma Workflow

- Access your content library and apply content to designs instantly.

- Real-time brand guideline compliance checking within your design files.

- Effortlessly preview designs across multiple language variants.
plugins.tagline: Deliver UX Content consistent with brand guidelines

plugins.name: Find Duplicates
plugins.description: Effortlessly manage your Figma layers with this plugin that scans the root-level children of a selected node and identifies duplicates by name. Save time by automatically selecting all nodes with identical names, ensuring a clean and organized design structure. Ideal for designers working with complex hierarchies and naming conventions
plugins.tagline: Find and Select Nodes with Duplicate Names at Root Level

plugins.name: Starter Blueprint
plugins.description: Starter Blueprint is the ultimate Figma plugin to streamline your project setup. With just one click, automatically generate essential pages for wireframes, UI design, and design systems, helping you stay organized from day one. Whether you're building a new interface, creating reusable components, or setting up your design guidelines, Starter Blueprint simplifies the process, letting you focus on the creative side. With future updates bringing even more customizable templates and features, Starter Blueprint is your go-to tool for a smarter, more efficient workflow.
plugins.tagline: Launch Your Figma Projects with a Solid Starting Point!

plugins.name: Page Assistant
plugins.description:
A 🗂️ Page Assistant to help you quickly set up your files and pages structure the way you want them; on new or existing files. No more need for duplicating template files.


§ Sections

Automatically apply your desired file sections with dividers on existing or new files.


⚙️ Customizable

Customize these sections name and order to your specific needs, and save your preferences for future use.


✏️ Page names

Batch-apply a page name prefix and/or suffix to all non-section pages.


This is a work in progress. All feedback is welcome!

accepted.name: alfonso
accepted.description:
Designer and artist from Uruguay, based in New York City.

Currently Director, Product Design at Fabric Health. Ex. Particle Health

plugins.tagline: Add and remove sections on your file & format page names

plugins.name: ChromaPulse
plugins.description:
“ChromaPulse” is an image color analysis plugin of Figma, that extracts dominant and prominent colors from nodes which are filled with an image and generates palettes.


***** This plugin is a one-time paid plugin, with up to 5 trials available. *****


👉 Check out the details on ChromaPulse Website.

🔑 You can buy a License Key on Gumroad.


//


“ChromaPulse” は塗りに画像が設定されたノードのドミナントカラー（支配色）やプロミネントカラー（特長色）を抽出し、パレットを生成する Figma で動作する色調解析プラグインです。


***** このプラグインは1回払いの有料プラグインで、5回までのトライアルが可能です。 *****


👉 詳しくは ChromaPulse ウェブサイト をご覧ください。

🔑 ライセンスキーは Gumroad でご購入いただけます。
plugins.tagline: ChromaPulse is an image color analysis plugin of Figma, that extracts dominant and prominent colors.

plugins.name: Speedy Proto
plugins.description: Create simple prototypes in one click, no matter how messy your Figma files are. plugins.name: Composer
plugins.description:
Quickly organise your components in a structured grid.

Composer helps you quickly arrange component variants in Figma, making your workspace more organised and efficient.


⚡️ Key features:

  1. Auto-Layout Support.
  2. Easily adjust spacing and positioning to fit your needs.
  3. Structure your components in a clear format up to a 4×4 Grid Layout.
  4. Instantly add a dark background behind selection for better visibility.


Keep your projects clean, organised, and faster to ship into integration! 🚀

plugins.name: CopyCraft
plugins.description:
Streamline your text editing workflow with a powerful tool that helps you manage and edit text content across your Figma designs with precision and ease.

How it Works:


Text Loading:

Select any frame or text element in your Figma document and load it into the editor with a single click.


Smart Organization:

  1. Texts are automatically grouped by their parent elements (Frames, Components, or Groups)
  2. Each text element shows its character count and previous versions
  3. Intuitive interface for quick access to all text elements


Efficient Editing:

  1. Edit multiple text elements simultaneously
  2. Apply text styles directly from the editor
  3. Preview changes in real-time
  4. Navigate quickly to specific elements in your design


Key Features:

  1. Character counter for precise text control
  2. Previous version tracking for each text element
  3. Direct navigation to elements in your design
  4. Batch saving capabilities for groups of text
  5. Support for text styles application


Perfect for teams working on large-scale designs where maintaining text consistency and efficiency in editing is crucial.
plugins.tagline: Text Management Made Simple

plugins.name: Markdown Import
plugins.description:
このプラグインは、Google Docsやメモ帳などからコピーしたマークダウン形式のテキストを、Figmaのページ内にインポートするツールです。

「# 見出し1 」「 ## 見出し2」「### 見出し3」「本文」の構造を自動で判別し、それぞれに対応するコンポーネントを選択して挿入することができます。


【主な機能】

  1. マークダウン記法でコピー＆ペースト → 自動でレイアウト生成
  2. 見出し1〜3、本文、それぞれに同一ページ内の任意のコンポーネントを割り当て可能
  3. コンポーネント内のテキストレイヤーを自動で認識し、文字を置換


---


This plugin lets you import markdown-style text into your Figma page directly from Google Docs, Notepad, or any markdown editor.


It automatically parses the structure of your content—such as # Heading 1, ## Heading 2, ### Heading 3, and body text —and allows you to assign custom components for each section during import.


【Key Features】

  1. Paste markdown-formatted text and auto-generate layout in Figma
  2. Assign your preferred components for headings (H1–H3) and body text
  3. Detect and replace text inside the designated layer of each component
plugins.tagline: マークダウンのテキストをコンポーネントを適用してインポート | Import markdown into Figma with component mapping.

plugins.name: DeepL Translator
plugins.description:
DeepL Translator


A Figma plugin that quickly translates text within frames using the DeepL API.

The acceleration feature enables faster translations and cost savings.


Features


  1. 🚀 Fast Translation: Re-use past translation history for fast fast translation
  2. 💰️ Cost Saving: Save API Usage by Re-use past translation history
  3. 🌐 Multi-language Support: Supports 29 languages
  4. 📚 Glossary Support: Use DeepL glossaries for consistent translations
  5. 🌍 Auto Detection: Automatic source language detection
  6. 📝 Non-destructive: Creates new frames for translations while preserving originals
  7. 🎯 Simple Operation: Just select languages and click translate


How to Use


  1. Get a DeepL API key (see below)
  2. Select a frame containing text to translate
  3. Choose source and target languages
  4. (Optional) Select a glossary
  5. Click "Translate"
  6. Translation results appear in a new frame


Getting a DeepL API Key


1. Sign up for a DeepL API account at DeepL.

  1. Free plan available (500,000 characters/month)
  2. Pro plan available for more usage

2. Get your API key:

  1. Log in to your DeepL account
  2. Go to "Account" → "API keys"
  3. Copy your API key

3. Enter your API key in the plugin settings


Glossary


You can set up glossary on DeepL Web Console.

https://support.deepl.com/hc/en-us/articles/360021634540-About-the-glossary

https://www.deepl.com/ja/glossary?sortColumn=name&sortDirection=asc


Please let me know via feedback form if you have a good reason to edit the Glossary on the Plugin directly.


Supported Languages


See the complete list of supported languages for details.


Major languages include:


  1. English (EN)
  2. Chinese (ZH)
  3. Korean (KO)
  4. German (DE)
  5. French (FR)
  6. Spanish (ES)
  7. Italian (IT)
  8. Dutch (NL)
  9. Japanese (JA)
  10. Portuguese (PT)
  11. Russian (RU)


And 18 more languages


Notes


  1. DeepL API key required (available with free plan)
  2. Free plan includes 500,000 characters per month
  3. Source language must be specified when using glossaries
  4. API keys are securely encrypted and stored


Support & Feedback


We welcome your feedback! Please contact to developer through:


- Contact Form for:

  1. Questions & Inquiries
  2. Feature Requests
  3. Bug Reports
  4. General Feedback


Privacy

  1. DeepL API keys are securely encrypted
  2. Translation data is processed on DeepL servers and not stored on this plugin server.
plugins.tagline: Translate texts in Figma by DeepL

plugins.name: Remote Variable Replacer
plugins.description:
Sometimes Figma variables aren’t coming from inside the house. While this plugin has a likely very tiny amount of potential users, if I can help anybody save any time trying to locate and replace variables that are orphans or “remote”, then this has been worth it.


For whatever reason, variables in Figma can be attached to other libraries, older files, archived files even. This can cause major headaches when editing local variables and components don’t seem to respond to the edits.


I fully expect this plugin to have a limited lifespan as Figma themselves will likely improve variable handling during copy/pastes, schema renaming or other scenarios where variables can be orphaned.


In the meantime, I got you.
plugins.tagline: Replace those pesky remote variables!

135284.name: Remote Variable Replacer
135284.description:
Sometimes Figma variables aren’t coming from inside the house. While this plugin has a likely very tiny amount of potential users, if I can help anybody save any time trying to locate and replace variables that are orphans or “remote”, then this has been worth it.


For whatever reason, variables in Figma can be attached to other libraries, older files, archived files even. This can cause major headaches when editing local variables and components don’t seem to respond to the edits.


I fully expect this plugin to have a limited lifespan as Figma themselves will likely improve variable handling during copy/pastes, schema renaming or other scenarios where variables can be orphaned.


In the meantime, I got you.
135284.release_notes:
Improved the dropdowns for numerical variables to only show local variables whose base value match the remote variable base value. This should make the plugin easy to navigate if a user has hundreds of variables.

Removed beta language; Included network access for tailwind for easy stying and unpkg.com for React. This should fix the blank screen of death. Rookie mistake!

Also updated the data security details to let users know the network access is only for static items.

plugins.name: Fijira
plugins.description:
Streamline your workflow and eliminate the gap between design and project management with Fijira. This powerful plugin seamlessly connects your Figma designs directly to your Jira tickets, ensuring that your development team always has access to the latest frames, feedback, and design specifications.


Stop wasting time manually exporting assets and pasting links. With Fijira, you can create detailed Jira comments, update ticket statuses, and link specific Figma frames directly from within your design file.


Key Features:


One-Click Jira Comments: Create rich, formatted comments in Jira tickets directly from Figma.

Automatic Frame Linking: Automatically attach a link to your selected Figma frame. If no frame is selected, you have the option to paste a link manually.

Status Updates: View available transitions and update the status of your Jira tickets without leaving Figma.

Simple Markdown Editor: Format your comments with bold, italics, lists, and links to keep your communication clear and organized.

Secure & Private: Your Jira credentials are saved securely in your local Figma storage and are never exposed. All communication happens through a secure, private proxy server.

Easy Setup: A simple, one-time setup for your Jira domain, email, and API token gets you started in minutes.

How to Use:


Run the Plugin: Open Fijira from the plugins menu.

Enter Your Settings: In the settings view, enter your Jira domain (e.g., your-company.atlassian.net), your Jira account email, and a valid Jira API token.

Select a Frame (Optional): Select a single frame in your Figma file that you want to link.

Fill in Commit Details: In the commit view, enter a commit title, a detailed description (using the markdown editor!), and the target Jira issue key (e.g., PROJ-123).

Update Status (Optional): Choose a new status for your Jira ticket from the dropdown menu.

Commit! Click "Commit & Update Jira". Fijira will post your comment, link, and status change to the specified Jira ticket and create a new version in your Figma file history.

Say goodbye to context switching and hello to a more efficient workflow with Fijira!
plugins.tagline: Sync your Figma designs with Jira issue, seamlessly.

136661.name: Fijira
136661.description:
Streamline your workflow and eliminate the gap between design and project management with Fijira. This powerful plugin seamlessly connects your Figma designs directly to your Jira tickets, ensuring that your development team always has access to the latest frames, feedback, and design specifications.


Stop wasting time manually exporting assets and pasting links. With Fijira, you can create detailed Jira comments, update ticket statuses, and link specific Figma frames directly from within your design file.


Key Features:


One-Click Jira Comments: Create rich, formatted comments in Jira tickets directly from Figma.

Automatic Frame Linking: Automatically attach a link to your selected Figma frame. If no frame is selected, you have the option to paste a link manually.

Status Updates: View available transitions and update the status of your Jira tickets without leaving Figma.

Simple Markdown Editor: Format your comments with bold, italics, lists, and links to keep your communication clear and organized.

Secure & Private: Your Jira credentials are saved securely in your local Figma storage and are never exposed. All communication happens through a secure, private proxy server.

Easy Setup: A simple, one-time setup for your Jira domain, email, and API token gets you started in minutes.

How to Use:


Run the Plugin: Open Fijira from the plugins menu.

Enter Your Settings: In the settings view, enter your Jira domain (e.g., your-company.atlassian.net), your Jira account email, and a valid Jira API token.

Select a Frame (Optional): Select a single frame in your Figma file that you want to link.

Fill in Commit Details: In the commit view, enter a commit title, a detailed description (using the markdown editor!), and the target Jira issue key (e.g., PROJ-123).

Update Status (Optional): Choose a new status for your Jira ticket from the dropdown menu.

Commit! Click "Commit & Update Jira". Fijira will post your comment, link, and status change to the specified Jira ticket and create a new version in your Figma file history.

Say goodbye to context switching and hello to a more efficient workflow with Fijira!
136661.tagline: Sync your Figma designs with Jira issue, seamlessly.

plugins.name: Find lost local — «Найти потерянные локальные компоненты»
plugins.description:
🔍 Find lost local automatically catches every local instance whose master component lives in another library / document.

Just set a prefix symbol (default “_”) and choose the search scope—current page or whole file.


Features

•Any nesting depth – detects instances hidden inside local components and their masters.

•Page-level grouping – shows how many problematic components each page contains.

•One-click jump – selects and zooms to the target instance.

•Custom prefix – works with _Tabs, .hidden, -draft, @deprecated, or any symbol you use for local components.


When it helps

•Before publishing a library – make sure no stray local copies remain in the file.

•During a design-system migration – quickly spot legacy components that still point elsewhere.

•While reviewing external files – instantly see what is pulled from external libraries.


How to use

1.Open the plugin and, if needed, change the prefix symbol.

2.Pick Current page or Whole file and click Search.

3.Review the grouped list. Clicking a component name jumps to its first found instance.

4.Items labelled “Outside pages” exist only inside master components; fix them in the corresponding library.


The plugin works entirely inside Figma—no internet access required, and no data ever leaves your account.


🔍 Find lost local автоматически вылавливает в вашем файле любые локальные инстансы, мастеры которых живут в другой библиотеке / документе.

Достаточно указать символ-префикс (по умолчанию — «_») и выбрать область поиска — текущую страницу или весь файл.


Возможности

  1. Любая глубина вложенности: находит инстансы, спрятанные внутри локальных компонентов и их мастеров.
  2. Группировка по страницам с подсчётом, сколько проблемных компонентов найдено на каждой.
  3. Переход одним кликом: выбирает и фокусирует нужный инстанс.
  4. Настраиваемый префикс: работает не только с «_Tabs», но и с «.hidden», «-draft», «@deprecated» — любым символом, который вы используете для локальных компонентов.


Когда пригодится

  1. Перед публикацией библиотеки — убедитесь, что в файле нет «висящих» локальных копий.
  2. Во время миграции компонентов из старой дизайн-системы в новую.
  3. При ревью сторонних файлов, чтобы сразу увидеть, что тянется из внешних библиотек.


Как пользоваться

  1. Откройте плагин и при необходимости поменяйте символ-префикс.
  2. Выберите Текущая страница или Весь файл и нажмите Поиск.
  3. Изучите сгруппированный список. Клик по названию компонента перенесёт вас к первому найденному инстансу.
  4. Компоненты, отмеченные как «Вне страницы», находятся только внутри мастеров — их можно исправить в контексте соответствующей библиотеки.


Плагин не требует интернет-доступа и не отправляет данные за пределы вашего аккаунта Figma.
plugins.tagline: Find all local component instances whose master lives in another file

plugins.name: Auto Layout Checker
plugins.description:
Auto Layout Checker helps you maintain design consistency by identifying and converting elements that don't use Auto Layout. Perfect for cleaning up designs and ensuring layout consistency across your files.


🔍 Key Features:

• Scan entire pages or selected elements for missing Auto Layout

• One-click conversion of frames and groups to Auto Layout

• Clear visual feedback for converted elements

• Theme-aware interface that matches your Figma theme

• Quick navigation to elements through direct selection


🎯 Perfect for:

• Design system cleanup and maintenance

• Legacy file modernization

• Team collaboration and consistency checks

• Quick Auto Layout implementation


💡 How to use:

1. Select elements to scan (or leave unselected to scan entire page)

2. Click "Scan" to find elements without Auto Layout

3. Click any element to navigate to it in your design

4. Use the "Convert" button to instantly apply Auto Layout


The plugin automatically applies sensible Auto Layout defaults:

• Vertical layout orientation

• 10px spacing between elements

• 10px padding on all sides

• Automatic sizing for both axes


Keep your designs maintainable and responsive with Auto Layout Checker!
plugins.tagline: Quickly find and convert elements missing Auto Layout, streamlining your design system consistency.

plugins.name: Screenshot to 100%
plugins.description:
The plugin quickly scales selected images to 100% of their real screenshot size in one click.


On Windows, if your display scaling (for example, 175%) is set above 100%, screenshots are captured at a larger size and look incorrect when pasted into Figma. This plugin helps you downscale screenshots so they appear correctly in Figma.


To use the plugin properly, set the same scale value in the plugin settings as in your Windows display settings.

accepted.name: Nik M
accepted.description: UX/UI/Product designer with more than 10+ years exp.

plugins.tagline: The plugin quickly scales selected images to 100% of their real screenshot size in one click.

129333.name: Screenshot to 100%
129333.description:

On Windows, if your display scaling (for example, 175%) is set above 100%, screenshots are captured at a larger size and look incorrect when pasted into Figma. This plugin helps you downscale screenshots so they appear correctly in Figma.


To use the plugin properly, set the same scale value in the plugin settings as in your Windows display settings.
129333.tagline: The plugin quickly scales selected images to 100% of their real screenshot size in one click.

plugins.name: Colors to Variables
plugins.description:
✨ Colors to Variables


Save time and stay organized by turning your color swatches into Figma variables — automatically.


How it works:

•Select one or more frames or components

•Each must include a solid fill

•Each must contain a text layer named “Name” (this becomes the variable name)


Your palette, variable-ready.


Perfect for building or maintaining design systems with consistent, reusable color variables.
plugins.tagline: Your palette, variable-ready.

128273.name: Colors to Variables
128273.description:

Your palette, variable-ready.


Perfect for building or maintaining design systems with consistent, reusable color variables.

plugins.name: JSON -> Swatches
plugins.description:
Turn JSON into color swatches in Figma sorted by color.


Each swatch includes the color name (if given) as well as Hex and opacity values.


You can add an optional tag for extra detail if/when importing multiple libraries.


Auditing an existing design system? JSON -> Swatches is a great tool for mapping old color libraries to new.
plugins.tagline: Turn JSON into Color Swatches in Figma

127062.tagline: Turn JSON into Color Swatches in Figma

plugins.name: NornAI - Boost Your Design and Content with AI
plugins.description:
🔮 NornAI: Harness the power of artificial intelligence to transform and adapt your texts, adjusting tone and style to create unique and engaging designs. Inspired by mythology, this plugin offers a magical and personalized experience.




✨ Key Features


Text transformation with predefined tones: standard, success, error, call to action, and more.

Quick suggestions to summarize, expand, simplify, and make text more persuasive or friendly.

Image search and insertion with a special themed interface.



🛠️ How to Use


1. Text Transformation

  1. Select the desired text.
  2. Choose a voice tone or quick suggestion.
  3. Use custom prompts for specific instructions.
  4. Click on one of the generated alternatives to apply.



2. Image Search

  1. Access the "Images" tab.
  2. Enter your search and optionally select a color filter.
  3. Click on an image to insert it into the project.
plugins.tagline: Enhance your design workfklow with AI

networkAccess.reasoning: The plugin needs to access any domain because it fetches images from DuckDuckGo search results, which can come from any website. The image URLs are not known in advance and can be from any domain on the internet.

125952.tagline: Enhance your design workfklow with AI

plugins.name: Layer Name Selector
plugins.description:
🔍 Finding the right layers in your design just got easier!


Layer Name Selector lets you define a scope (either the entire page or the selected area), choose specific layer types, and automatically select all matching layers with a single click.


Features:

1️⃣ Define scope: Work on the current page or only within selected elements.

2️⃣ Filter by layer type: Choose from Text, Instance, Component, Frame, Group and Rectangle.

3️⃣ One-click selection: Hit the "Select" button and let the plugin do the work!


Perfect for organizing large files, speeding up your workflow, and making precise edits in seconds. Try it out now! 🚀


☕️ Buy me a coffee
plugins.tagline: Quickly select layers by type and scope. Find what you need in seconds, effortlessly. 🔍

plugins.name: Amplifi for Figma
plugins.description:
Quickly assess how intelligible and understandable your text is from directly within the Figma app. The Amplifi Intelligibility Score is our proprietary score that combines a wide range of intelligibility metrics. The score takes into consideration what words actually mean and considers how difficult those concepts are to understand. This creates a true assessment of intelligibility risk.


Key features:

  1. Instantly assess intelligibility for content frames and text nodes.
  2. See a detailed breakdown of what is causing complexity within the text.
  3. See the improvement in scoring after making edits and changes to the text.

accepted.name: Amplifi
accepted.description: Assess and simplify your regulated communications

plugins.tagline: Assess and simplify your regulated communications

plugins.name: not a status
plugins.description:
Плагин для управления статусами и задачами в макетах Figma. Разработан для оптимизации рабочего процесса.

Основные возможности:

  1. Быстрое управление статусами макетов: "В процессе", "На проверку", "Не актуально", "Готово"
  2. Привязка номеров задач к макетам с автоматическим созданием кликабельных ссылок
  3. Конвертация номеров задач [...] из названия фрейма в интерактивные ссылки
  4. Настраиваемый URL-шаблон для задач
  5. Поддержка статуса "Как на проде" для готовых макетов, сверенных с продом
  6. Автоматическое создание и обновление метаданных фрейма

Как использовать:

  1. Выберите фрейм
  2. Установите нужный статус
  3. Добавьте номера связанных задач
  4. Готово! Плагин автоматически создаст метаданные и настроит все связи

Для кого:

  1. Дизайнеры
  2. Разработчики
  3. Менеджеры проектов
  4. Команды, использующие Figma в рабочем процессе

Особенности:

  1. Интуитивно понятный интерфейс
  2. Быстрый доступ к часто используемым функциям
  3. Автоматическое сохранение настроек
  4. Поддержка горячих клавиш
plugins.tagline: 🚀 Простой способ связать макеты с задачами и управлять их статусами.

plugins.name: QuickToken
plugins.description:
QuickToken is the Figma plugin that enables instant variable import and seamless organization. Designed for designers who prioritize efficiency, QuickToken allows you to quickly insert variables into Figma’s local variables as design tokens. It supports collections and groups, keeping all variables clear and organized. Simplify your variable management and speed up your workflow with this powerful, efficient plugin!


Supported name schemes:


Create Variable Collection

#Collection


Create Variable Group

Group/


Create Variable

variable-name: value


The variable type recognition is automatically

based on the variable value itself.


Supported variable types


  1. Float 30
  2. Colors #333, #334455, rgb(0,100,100), rgba(2,2,2,0.1)
  3. Boolean: true, false
  4. String: 'Hello'
  5. Variable link: var(variable-name)

accepted.name: Roland Hidvegi
accepted.description: Roland Hidvegi is a Product Designer — crafting digital experiences, from vision to final touches, passionate about creating things that make people happy.

plugins.tagline: Instant variable import and organization in Figma.

plugins.name: DxH - Layer2JSON
plugins.description: DxH - Layer2JSON is a Figma plugin by Devxhub Ltd. that exports design layers (text, images, shapes) to structured JSON format. Perfect for developers looking to integrate Figma designs into apps or workflows, it supports nested layers and exports essential design properties like size, position, and styles.

plugins.name: Paste Large Images
plugins.description:
Stop wasting time saving huge reference screenshots to disk—just paste or import them directly into your file, at full quality.


What it does

  1. 🥸 Paste or select file: Use ⌘ + V / Ctrl + V or click “select file” to bring in any image.
  2. 🔪 Smart slicing: Large images are automatically chopped into Figma-friendly tiles, so you never lose resolution.
  3. 🚀 Instant placement: Your screenshot drops right into view, wrapped in a frame or a group—no extra steps, no quality loss.
plugins.tagline: Instantly paste or insert high-resolution screenshots into Figma

136944.name: Paste Large Images
136944.description:

  2. 🔪 Smart slicing: Large images are automatically chopped into Figma-friendly tiles, so you never lose resolution.
  3. 🚀 Instant placement: Your screenshot drops right into view, wrapped in a frame or a group—no extra steps, no quality loss.
136944.tagline: Instantly paste or insert high-resolution screenshots into Figma

plugins.name: Wave Flag Insert Plugin
plugins.description:
Insert beautifully crafted country flags directly into your Figma designs with one click.


FlagPack SVG makes it easy to browse, search, and insert high-quality SVG flags into your design projects. Simply search for a country name, click on the flag, and it appears right on your canvas—ready to scale, customize, or use as-is.


How to Use:


  1. Open the plugin in Figma.


  1. Use the search bar to find a specific flag.


  1. Click on any flag to insert it into your current page.


Done!


Ideal for UI mockups, dashboards, internationalization features, and travel apps.

accepted.name: Open Wave.io
accepted.description: Open Wave is an open-source organization Founded by Lawrence Okosa III. creating tools that streamline design and development workflows.

plugins.tagline: Drop any country flag into your design in seconds

plugins.name: Promptus
plugins.description:
Promptus is a free Figma plugin that turns text or images into high-quality AI image prompts—all in just seconds, without leaving Figma.


⸻


Available tools

•Text-to-Prompt – type a brief and receive a detailed prompt

•Image-to-Prompt – upload an image and extract the underlying prompt

•One-Click Copy – copy the ready-to-use prompt wherever you need


⸻


Set up your Google Gemini API key in Promptus:


Open Promptus inside Figma.

Click the gear icon (Settings) in the top-right corner of the plugin panel.

Go to Google AI Studio.

Click “Sign in to Google AI Studio” and authenticate with your Google account.

In the top header, click the “Get API Key” button.

When prompted, click “Create API key”.

In the project pop-up, enter a project name (or select an existing one) and confirm.


Thank you for choosing Promptus! 🤩

👉 If you have any questions or suggestions, let us know — your feedback makes all the difference.
plugins.tagline: Instantly generate detailed AI image prompts in Figma

plugins.name: Palettano - Color Palette Library
plugins.description:
🎨✨ Description with Emojis:

Palettano is your ultimate 🎯 design companion for color 🎨 perfection!

Explore a curated library of 500+ beautiful color palettes 🌈, ready to inspire your next project 💡.


🔍 Search palettes by mood, theme, or keyword

🖥️ Test palettes on real UI layouts before committing

📐 Preview colors in buttons, cards, backgrounds & more

🎯 Stay consistent with your brand or product design

⚡ Fast, smooth, and intuitive—built for creative minds!


Whether you're a designer 👩‍🎨, developer 👨‍💻, or color enthusiast 🎉, Palettano makes picking the perfect palette effortless and fun 🚀.
plugins.tagline: Access 500+ curated palettes and preview them live—design consistent, colorful interfaces

plugins.name: STAR Method for Figma
plugins.description:
STAR Method for Figma

Struggling to explain your design process in interviews? The STAR Method for Figma helps you:


Features:

✨ Structure case studies with {Situation - Task - Action - Result},

✨ Link stories directly to your Figma frames,

✨ Practice answering behavioral questions,

✨ Export snippets for portfolios & interviews.


How to use:

1. Open any Figma project

2. Fill in STAR sections

3. Copy your interview-ready story!


Open it in your Case Study to try Now!
plugins.tagline: Transform your designs into interview-winning stories.

plugins.name: EasySpotlight
plugins.description: EasySpotlight makes it simple to highlight key areas you want to focus on. Just turn your original image into a frame, add a new frame over the area you want to spotlight, select two frames, and click the "Create Spotlight" button. The plugin will dim the background and create a custom highlight—perfect for presentations, tutorials, or showcasing design details!
plugins.tagline: Spotlight key areas, dim the rest.
